programme.title: Rock and Roll Revue
programme.desc: Vintage clips of great jazz artists.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: "Coming To Soul Flix" features "Arena," "The Big Doll House," "Caged Heat," "Assault on Precinct 13," "The Bad Bunch" and others.

programme.title: The Borrower
programme.desc: The police (Rae Dawn Chong, Don Gordon) follow the work of an alien who borrows and then sheds human heads.

programme.title: 1990: The Bronx Warriors
programme.desc: The Manhattan Corporation sends an agent (Vic Morrow) to rescue its heiress from the no-man's-land Bronx.

programme.title: Warriors of the Year 2072
programme.desc: In 2072 Rome, Italy, a ruthless TV network CEO plots to stage a modern series of gladiator games for ratings.

programme.title: Robotrix
programme.desc: A scientist transfers the memories of a dead policewoman (Chikako Aoyama) into a robot body.

programme.title: Endgame
programme.desc: Chen Xiaomeng, an ill-fated actor, assumes the identity of Zhou Quan, an assassin with memory loss. He soon finds himself deep in trouble as he crosses paths with the world's most notorious criminals.

programme.title: Starcrash
programme.desc: A space explorer and his girlfriend try to protect Earth from devastation.

programme.title: Black Brigade
programme.desc: A group of soldiers with no combat experience hold a World War II dam for their bigoted captain (Stephen Boyd).

programme.title: Crazy Mama
programme.desc: An evicted mother (Ann Sothern) and daughter (Cloris Leachman) lead a cross-country 1950s crime spree.

programme.title: Big Bad Mama
programme.desc: A woman (Angie Dickinson) drives around Texas with her daughters and gang (William Shatner, Tom Skerritt), robbing banks during the Depression.

programme.title: Get Christie Love!
programme.desc: A beautiful detective (Teresa Graves) goes under cover to investigate a huge drug ring in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Under the Cherry Moon
programme.desc: News of a trust-fund beauty (Kristin Scott Thomas) inspires the pianist (Prince) at a hotel in Nice on the Riviera.

programme.title: Graffiti Bridge
programme.desc: The Kid (Prince) and his rock-club rival (Morris Day) disagree about music in a sequel to the 1984 film "Purple Rain."

programme.title: That's the Way of the World
programme.desc: Record-industry mobsters make an executive (Harvey Keitel) push a boring family trio instead of Earth, Wind & Fire.

programme.title: Sparkle
programme.desc: The demands of success take their toll on three Harlem sisters who reach the heights of musical stardom in the 1950s.
